Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n420n2EJp21rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/07d03274d04bfaf9b3d7a9623c2b0101/tumblr_inline_n420pzWiVT1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>Hankering for a change of pace from the tweaks presented in <strong>.23.5</strong>? <strong>stupid_chris</strong> has an option for you. The <a href="http://bit.ly/1gxTshH"><strong>Stock Rebalance Project</strong></a> is a ModuleManager file at heart, presenting a large list of part modifications underneath the hood for those looking for a different way to experience <em><strong>ARM</strong></em>. There’s plenty of room for growth, too, thanks to a revisions process made by community feedback.</p>

<p>Find out more about the <a href="http://bit.ly/1gxTshH"><strong>Stock Rebalance Project</strong></a>.</p>
Good that SQUAD shows this. Now the people that like ARM the way they like it, and those that don't get this.

This isnt any nerf to be afraid of.

1.5 TWR coming off the pad. Fuel in nosecones and adapters. And other small changes. Check out the changelist, stay for the rockets. And lift big things into space with rockets that look like rockets, not hexagonal footstools.

Edited April 15, 2014 by Rakaydos
Hm, sounds cool, have to test it! Thanks for posting it here
I agree with a lot of the rebalancing, like adding mass to batteries, but I don`t want all of it. Is there a way to `pcik and choose` which parts are altered?
I think it's just a matter of deleting the relevant section in the cfgs in the download, as I think SRP is basically Module Manager configs.

I agree with a lot of the rebalancing, like adding mass to batteries, but I don`t want all of it. Is there a way to `pcik and choose` which parts are altered?

The configs are separated by type and such, generally some quick look should point you to the right one
Hmmmm, this looks like it might be worth giving it a try
